page.title: 01Wembworthy and Environs
page.content: Wembworthy is essentially a settlement of about eighty houses - the of the village is around the church where is also situated an 18C? Tudor Manor house and church hall. Then the area was administered by the portsmouth family, Wembworthy was the land aents house omplete with round house for local milling needs. There are of cottages near parsonage Moor and numerous of gravestones originating from earlier settlement which as yet remain uninvestigated. In the village steet are several village wells in the wells of houses which would have served three or four houses. There is a village hall used for badminton youth club and occasionaly other social activities.Once a week a bus takes villagers through into
